<div class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="2" id="pf2"><div class="pc pc2 w0 h0"><div class="t m0 x0 h8 y69 ff6 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls10">·<span class="ff2 ls11 wsf"> </span><span class="ff5 fs3 ls16 ws1a">Contractive plagiarism<span class="ff4 wsf"> <span class="_ _7"></span>de<span class="_ _0"></span>scribes <span class="_ _3"></span><span class="ws1a">the sum<span class="_ _1"></span>mary or trimming of</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x10 h6 y6a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsf">copied mater<span class="_ _1"></span>ial <span class="ls16 ws7">[26]<span class="ls2 ws10">; </span><span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h8 y6b ff6 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls10">·<span class="ff2 ls11 wsf"> </span><span class="ff5 fs3 ls16 ws30">Mosaic plagiarism<span class="ff4 wsf"> encompasses <span class="_ _d"></span><span class="ws30">the merge of text segments</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x10 h6 y6c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">from <span class="_ _4"></span><span class="ws1f">different sources and obfuscating the plagiarism by</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x10 h6 y6d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws20">changing word order, substituting words with synonyms or</div>
<div class="t m0 x10 h6 y6e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">entering/deleting filling words [<span class="ls1c wsc">26<span class="ls3 ws21">, </span></span><span class="ws7">49]<span class="ls2 ws3b">; </span><span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y6f ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws4e">Technical disguise<span class="ff4 wsf"> <span class="_ _7"></span>s<span class="ls3 ws5f">ummarizes</span> <span class="_ _5"></span>techni<span class="_ _0"></span>ques <span class="_ _7"></span>for <span class="_ _7"></span><span class="ws4e">hiding plagiarized</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y70 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws63">content from being automatically detected by exploiting</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y71 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws22">weaknesses off current text-<span class="ls3 ws64">based anal<span class="_ _1"></span>ysis methods<span class="_ _1"></span> e.g. <span class="ls1c ws33">by</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y72 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">substituting characters with graphically identical symbols from</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y73 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws21">foreign alphabets or inserting le<span class="ws2a">tters in white font color [20]</span><span class="ls3">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y74 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1a">Undue paraphrasing<span class="ff4 ls22 wsf"> </span><span class="ff4">defines the intentional rewriting of foreign</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y75 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws30">thoughts in the vocabulary and style of the plagiarist without</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y76 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">giving due credit for concealing the original source [26]<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls3 ws21">. <span class="ls16 wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y77 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws65">Translated plagiarism<span class="ff4 ls23 wsf"> </span><span class="ff4">is defined as the <span class="ls3 ws66">manu<span class="_ _1"></span>al or au<span class="_ _1"></span>tomated</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y78 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws67">conversion of content from one language to another intended to</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y79 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws21">cover its origin [49]<span class="ls3 wsf">. <span class="ls16"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y7a ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws40">Idea plagiarism<span class="ff4 wsf"> <span class="_ _b"></span>encompas<span class="ws40">ses the usage of a broader foreign</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y7b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws68">concept without due source acknowledgement [<span class="ls1c wsc">28</span><span class="ws7">]<span class="ls3 ws69">. Examples are</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y7c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6a">the appropriation of research approaches and methods,</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y7d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws41">experimental setups, argumentative structures, background</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y7e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">sources etc<span class="ls1f">. </span><span class="wsf">[13].</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y7f ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">Self-plagiarism<span class="ff4 ls24 wsf"> <span class="ls3 ws6b">characteriz<span class="_ _1"></span>es the partial o<span class="_ _1"></span>r complete r<span class="_ _1"></span>euse of</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y80 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">one’s own previous writings not being justified by scientific goals,</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y81 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws44">e.g. for presenting updates or providing access to a larger</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y82 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws67">community, but primarily serving the author, e.g. for artificially</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y83 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws21">increasing citation counts [5<span class="ls3">, </span><span class="ws7">11]<span class="ls3 ws54">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h3 y84 ff3 fs1 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa">2.2<span class="ff1 ls9 wsf"> </span><span class="ls36 ws6c">Existing Pla<span class="_ _1"></span>giarism Detec<span class="_ _1"></span>tion Approac<span class="_ _1"></span>hes <span class="ls16 wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y85 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6d">Plagiarism Detection (PD) is a hypernym for computer-<span class="ls1c ws33">based</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y86 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">procedures supporting the identification of plagiarism incidences.</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y87 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6e">Existing PD methods can be categorized into external and</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y88 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">intrinsic approaches [26<span class="ls1f">, </span><span class="ws7">45]<span class="ls3 ws21">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y89 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws39">External PD<span class="ff4 ls16 wsf"> <span class="_ _9"></span>m<span class="_ _1"></span>ethod<span class="ws3a">s compare a suspicious document to a</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y8a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws5f">collection<span class="ls25 wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws23">of gen<span class="_ _1"></span>uine works. Different comparison strategies have</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y8b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">been proposed in <span class="ls2 ws5">this</span><span class="wsf"> context.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y8c ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">S<span class="ws6f">tring matching<span class="ff4 wsf"> <span class="_ _a"></span>procedures <span class="_ _a"></span>[2<span class="ls1f ws2a">, </span><span class="ws7">32<span class="ls3 ws21">, <span class="_ _3"></span></span></span>52] <span class="ls1b ws13">aim <span class="_ _a"></span><span class="ls1c ws33">to </span></span><span class="ws6f">identify longest</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y8d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6e">pairs of identical <span class="ls2 ws10">text <span class="_ _4"></span><span class="ls15 ws12">strings. <span class="_ _4"></span><span class="ls3 ws5f">These<span class="ls26 wsf"> </span></span>strings <span class="_ _4"></span><span class="ls3 ws70">are treat<span class="_ _1"></span>ed as</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y8e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">indicators for potential plagiarism if the share they represent with</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y8f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6d">regard to the overall text exceeds a chosen threshold. <span class="wsf">Suffix</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y90 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6d">document models,<span class="ls27 wsf"> </span>such as suffix trees or suffix arrays, have</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y91 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls1b ws13">mostly <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls16 ws2a">been used for that purpose<span class="ls28 wsf"> <span class="ls1c ws71">in the co<span class="_ _0"></span>ntext of<span class="_ _0"></span> PD</span><span class="ls3">. <span class="ls16"></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y92 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws72">The strength of substring matching methods is their perfect</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y93 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2e">detection accuracy with regard to literal text overlaps.<span class="ls29 wsf"> <span class="ls3 ws2f">Their<span class="_ _1"></span> major</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y94 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">drawbacks <span class="_ _4"></span><span class="ws1f">are the relative difficulty of detecti<span class="_ _0"></span>ng disguised</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y95 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">plagiarisms <span class="_ _d"></span><span class="ws65">as well a<span class="_ _0"></span>s the required computational effor<span class="ls2 ws10">t. <span class="_ _d"></span><span class="ls3 ws21">The</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y96 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws73">former fact is intuitive when recalling the exact matchin<span class="_ _1"></span>g</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y97 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws53">approach of the detection procedure. The later barrier results fro<span class="_ _1"></span>m</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y98 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">the <span class="_ _7"></span>us<span class="ls3 ws21">e <span class="_ _3"></span></span><span class="ws74">of suffix data structu<span class="ls3 ws75">res<span class="_ _1"></span>. The most s<span class="_ _1"></span>pace<span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ws74">efficient suffix</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y99 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">tree <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls16 ws7">[25]<span class="ws50">, suffix array <span class="wsf">[24] <span class="_ _0"></span></span>and suffix vector <span class="wsf">[33] <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls2 ws10">implementations</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y9a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws76">allow searching in linear time and require o<span class="ls3 ws77">n average </span><span class="ff7 ws60">~8<span class="ff8 ls2a"><span class="ff5 ls2b wsf"> </span></span></span><span class="ls37 ws4d">of</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y9b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws23">storage space, with <span class="ff8 ls2a"></span><span class="ls25 wsf"> </span>being the num<span class="_ _1"></span>ber of symbols in the original</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y9c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws45">document. String B-<span class="ls3 ws78">Trees<span class="_ _1"></span> allow sear<span class="_ _1"></span>ching in <span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ff8 ls2c"><span class="ff7 ls16 ws60">(<span class="ls2 ws61">log </span></span><span class="ls2d"><span class="ff7 ls16 ws60">)<span class="ff4 ws19">, but also</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y9d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">require multiple times the storage space of the<span class="_ _0"></span> original document</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y9e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">[25]<span class="ls3 ws21">. <span class="_ _3"></span></span><span class="wsf">This <span class="_ _a"></span><span class="ws79">renders them impracticable for most large document</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y9f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">collections.</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ya0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">Employing<span class="ff5 ls2e wsf"> <span class="ls3 ws7a">vector space r<span class="_ _1"></span>etrieval <span class="ff4 ls16 ws7b">based on different term units</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ya1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">has been proposed e.g. by [9<span class="ls3 ws21">, </span><span class="ws7">40</span><span class="ls1f">, </span>22]. Vector space models (VSM)<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya2 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws7a">are a standard<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls16 ws7b">, highly performance tuned Inf<span class="ws79">ormation Retrieval</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya3 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7c">(IR) concept that<span class="ls2f wsf"> </span>can overcome the effort-<span class="ls2 ws7d">related limitations of<span class="_ _1"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya4 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7c">elaborate string matching. VSM <span class="wsf">consider <span class="_ _3"></span><span class="ls3 ws26">a set of</span><span class="ls2f"> <span class="ls3 ws21">terms, <span class="_ _3"></span></span></span>which</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya5 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">commonly <span class="_ _5"></span>has <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls1c wsc">be<span class="_ _0"></span>e</span><span class="ws28">n extracted from the whole document or larger</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya6 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3c">parts of the <span class="ls2 ws10">text, </span>for similarity computation. Therefore, vector</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya7 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws7e">space retri<span class="_ _1"></span>eval <span class="ls16 wsf">methods <span class="_ _7"></span><span class="ls2 ws7f">just like string m<span class="_ _1"></span>atching is<span class="ls30 wsf"> <span class="ls15 ws80">classified as</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya8 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws81">global similar<span class="_ _0"></span>ity assessments <span class="ls16 wsf">[47].</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ya9 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws82">The wel<span class="ls16 ws7">l-<span class="ws83">known cosine measure is a widely used similarit<span class="_ _1"></span>y</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yaa ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">function in PD settings as it is for other IR tasks. More complex</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yab ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws32">similarity functions tend to incorporate semantic information e.g.</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yac ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws57">by considering word synonyms <span class="wsf">[21] <span class="_ _3"></span></span>or pre-computing semantic</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yad ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">relations <span class="_ _a"></span>[48] <span class="_ _a"></span><span class="ws3f">between terms. The aforementioned papers show</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yae ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3f">that such considerations can increase detection performance, at</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yaf ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws85">the cost of significantly increasing t<span class="_ _0"></span>he computational effort</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">requir<span class="ws2e">ed. In the experiments reported in <span class="wsf">[3] </span>c<span class="_ _0"></span>onsidering synonyms</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws53">improved the F-measure of the respective detection procedures by</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb2 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">2-<span class="ws86">3 times. However, the runtime required for doing so increased</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb3 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">by more than 27 times. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb4 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws7e">The detect<span class="ls16 ws67">ion<span class="_ _1"></span> performance of VSM based PDS is dependent on</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb5 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws85">the individual plagiarism incidence to be analyzed and the</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb6 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws87">parameter configuration, e.g. term unit and term selection</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb7 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3e">strategy, of the specific detection method [18<span class="ls1c ws88">, p. 1</span>55]. However,</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb8 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">the global similarity assessment of VSMs tends to be de<span class="_ _0"></span>trimental</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yb9 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws50">to detection accuracy in PD settings. Verbatim plagia<span class="_ _0"></span>rism is more</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yba ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws74">commonly related to smaller, confined segments of a document,</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ybb ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">which favors local similarity analysis [47]<span class="ls3 ws21">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ybc ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">Fingerprinting<span class="ff4 ls31 wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws89">methods, being the most widely used PD</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ybd ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws33">approach, per<span class="_ _1"></span>form a local s<span class="_ _1"></span>imilarit<span class="_ _1"></span>y assessmen<span class="_ _1"></span>t. They aim <span class="ls16 ws71">to form<span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ybe ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws29">a representative digest of a document by selecting a set of</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ybf ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3e">multiple substrings from it. The set represents the fingerprint; it<span class="_ _1"></span>s</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws8a">elements are c<span class="_ _1"></span>alled min<span class="_ _1"></span>utiae <span class="ls16 ws7">[19]</span>. Mathem<span class="_ _1"></span>atical, hash<span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ls2 ws10">lik<span class="_ _1"></span>e</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">functions can be applied on minutiae for transforming them into</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc2 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">more space efficient byte strings [12]<span class="ls3 ws21">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc3 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">A suspicious document is checked for plagiarism by computing its</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc4 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws28">fingerprint and querying each minutia with a pre-computed index</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc5 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6e">of fingerprints for all documents of a reference collection.</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc6 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">Minutiae found matching with those of other documents indicate</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc7 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws44">shared text segments and suggest potential plagiarism <span class="wsf">upon</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc8 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws21">exceeding a certain similarity threshold <span class="wsf">[6].</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yc9 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3f">The inherent challenge of fingerprinting is finding a document</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yca ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws8b">representation that reduces computational effort to a <span class="ls1b ws13">suitable</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ycb ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws48">dimension, while limiting the information loss incurre<span class="_ _0"></span>d <span class="ls3 ws8c">to achieve<span class="_ _1"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ycc ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws8d">acceptable de<span class="_ _1"></span>tection accu<span class="_ _1"></span>racy <span class="ls16 ws7">[<span class="ls1c wsc">31</span>]</span><span class="ws21">. <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ls16 ws18">A number of<span class="ls32 wsf"> </span></span><span class="ws5f">parameters</span></span>, e<span class="_ _1"></span>.g.</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ycd ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">the chunking strategy, chunk size (granularity of the fingerprint)</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yce ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws43">or number of minutiae (resolution of the fingerprint),<span class="ls33 wsf"> <span class="ls1b ws4b">reflect that</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ycf ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws19">challenge. There is no definite answer to the question<span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _e"></span>of <span class="_ _e"></span><span class="ls1c ws33">whic<span class="_ _0"></span>h</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws8e">parameter com<span class="_ _1"></span>bination<span class="_ _1"></span> is the b<span class="_ _1"></span>est<span class="ls16 wsf">, <span class="_ _3"></span><span class="ws7c">since this choice is strongly</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws43">dependent on the nature and size of the collection as well as th<span class="ls3 ws21">e</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd2 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">amount and form of plagiarism. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd3 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">Conventional fingerprinting methods <span class="ls2 ws7d">implicitly encode the t<span class="_ _1"></span>erm</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd4 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws23">order of a document in proportion to the length of the chosen text</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd5 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">chunk. <span class="_ _7"></span><span class="ff9 ws60">S<span class="fs7 ls38 ws62 v0">TEIN</span></span><span class="ls34 v0"> <span class="ls16 ws4e">proposes an approach,<span class="_ _0"></span> termed fuzzy<span class="wsf">-fingerprinting,</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd6 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">which disregards term order by using a VSM of document terms</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd7 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws8f">instead of substrings for minutia computation [44]<span class="ls20 ws3d">.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd8 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls1b ws6">Fuzzy<span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ws90">Fingerprints are primarily targeted at reducing</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yd9 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws91">computational effort. Compared to fingerprinting using</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yda ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">word-3-<span class="ws53">grams and a MD5 hash<span class="ls35 wsf"> </span>function they can be computed >5</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ydb ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws92">times faster, but have been shown to be inferior in detection</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ydc ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">accuracy <span class="ls16 wsf">[47].</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 ydd ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws48">Intrinsic PD methods<span class="ff4">, opposed to the approaches presented so far,</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 yde ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws24">do not depend on the existence of a referenc<span class="ws6d">e corpus. They</span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye4 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3a">The linguistic features to be analyzed form a style model.</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye5 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9d">Approximately more than 1.000 individual style markers <span class="wsf">[38]</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye6 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws92">have been proposed for stylometry, <span class="ls3 ws9e">mos<span class="_ _1"></span>t can be c<span class="_ _1"></span>lassified a<span class="ls15 ws12">s</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye7 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">falling into one of the following categories<span class="wsf"> [46]:</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x10 h6 ye8 ffa fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws93">•<span class="ff2 ls39 wsf"> <span class="ff4 ls3 ws33">lexical featur<span class="_ _1"></span>es on character l<span class="_ _1"></span>evel, e.g. <span class="ff8 ls3a"></span><span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ws2e">gram frequency, or</span></span></span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 x10 h6 yeb ffa fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws93">•<span class="ff2 ls39 wsf"> </span><span class="ff4 ws9f">structural features, e.g. average paragraph length or</span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 yed ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws65">Style models of intrinsic PD<span class="ls1f ws2a">S <span class="_ _d"></span><span class="ls3 ws21">are <span class="_ _d"></span></span></span><span class="wsa0">generally c<span class="_ _0"></span>omprise<span class="wsf">d <span class="_ _d"></span></span></span>of an</div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y107 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa1">In previous paper<span class="wsf">s <span class="_ _9"></span>[4<span class="ls3 ws21">, <span class="_ _12"></span></span>15] <span class="_ _12"></span><span class="ls15 ws4">we</span><span class="ls3b"> </span><span class="wsa2">initially proposed employing</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y108 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7b">citation analysis for PD and presented results of <span class="ls2 ws5">in<span class="_ _1"></span>itial<span class="ls16 wsf"> <span class="_ _3"></span>studies<span class="ls3 ws21">.</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y109 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">Citation<span class="ls16 wsf">-based <span class="_ _7"></span><span class="ls15 wsa3">Pl<span class="_ _0"></span>agiarism Detect<span class="_ _0"></span></span><span class="ws7">ion</span><span class="ff4 ls3c"> <span class="ls16 ws1a">(CbPD) is a fundamentally</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y10a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa4">different approach compared to the text-<span class="ls1b wsa5">based si<span class="_ _0"></span>milarity<span class="_ _0"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y10b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws79">evaluations described above. It is especially intended for being</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y10c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws43">applied to scientific publications. Being substantially different<span class="ls1b ws4b">, it</span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y10f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">approaches presented above is given in <span class="wsf">Figure 1.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h3 y110 ff3 fs1 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa">2.3<span class="ff1 ls9 wsf"> </span><span class="ls49 wsa6">Strength and </span>W<span class="ls1d ws36">eaknesses of PDS</span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y111 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws29">As described in<span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _b"></span>[15] <span class="_ _b"></span>obje<span class="ls2 ws5">ctive</span> <span class="_ _12"></span>comparisons <span class="_ _b"></span>of <span class="_ _b"></span><span class="ls2 wsa7">the detection</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y112 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6f">performance achieved by individual PDS are difficult. Authors</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y113 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws71">proposing research prototypes tend to use different collections and</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y114 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa8">evaluation methods. Initiated in 2009 the annual PAN</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y115 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa9">International Competition on Plagiarism Detection (PAN-<span class="ls1f ws2a">PC)</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y116 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsaa">addresses this lack of comparability. It attempts to benchmark</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y117 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws67">PDS using a standardized collection and a controlled evaluation</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y118 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">environment <span class="_ _7"></span>[36]<span class="ws4e">. Results from the latest PAN-PC, held in June</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y119 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9f">2010, are presented for pointing out the capabilities of</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y11a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">state<span class="ls16 ws7">-of-the-<span class="ws2a">art PD prototypes.<span class="wsf"></span></span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y11c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">top 5 performing external PDS and the 2 intr<span class="_ _1"></span>insic PDS of M<span class="fs7 ls4a wsac v0">UHR</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h13 y11d ff4 fs7 fc0 sc0 ls4a wsad">ET AL<span class="fs3 ls16 wsf v0">. <span class="_ _b"></span>and <span class="_ _b"></span>S</span><span class="v0">UÁREZ ET AL<span class="fs3 ls16 wsf">. <span class="_ _b"></span><span class="ws40">participating in PAN-<span class="ws17">PC’10. The</span></span></span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y11f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws56">PAN competitions. It considers the<span class="_ _1"></span> <span class="ff7 ws60">F<span class="ff8 fs9 ls3e v2">1</span></span><span class="ls3f wsf"> <span class="ls1b wsaf">measure as well as the</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y120 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws32">granularity (<span class="ff5 ls1c wsc">gran</span>) of a<span class="_ _0"></span> detection method. The granularity reflects</div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y129 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsb2">each legend entr<span class="_ _1"></span>y. <span class="ls2 wsb3">Note that in <span class="ls16 wsb4">the legend “<span class="wsf">- <span class="_ _3"></span></span></span></span><span class="wsb5">I” is attached to<span class="_ _1"></span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y12e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws33">The results<span class="_ _1"></span> indicate<span class="_ _1"></span> that unchan<span class="_ _1"></span>ged copies<span class="_ _1"></span> of text s<span class="_ _1"></span>egments can<span class="_ _1"></span> be</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y12f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb7">detected with high accuracy by state-of-<span class="ls1c wsc">the<span class="_ _0"></span></span><span class="ws7">-<span class="ls1f wsb8">art PDS </span><span class="wsf">using<span class="_ _0"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y130 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws72">fingerprinting or bag of words analyses. Detection rates for</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y131 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb9">segments that were plagiarized and disguised by humans are</div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y133 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws5f">realist<span class="ls16 ws57">ically plagiarized segments could not be identified b<span class="_ _1"></span>y the</span></div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y13a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">foreign-<span class="ws7c">language documents in the reference corpus to English.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y13b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb9">The employed services, e.g. Google Translate, are similar or</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y13c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">identical to those used <span class="_ _0"></span>for constructing the translate<span class="ls3 ws8d">d, plagiari<span class="_ _1"></span>zed</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y13d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 wsbd">sections. It is<span class="_ _1"></span> hypothesized th<span class="_ _1"></span>at human<span class="ls16 ws7">-</span>made tran<span class="_ _1"></span>slations</div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y13f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">and <span class="ls3">hence less d<span class="_ _1"></span>etectable<span class="_ _1"></span> by the t<span class="_ _1"></span>ested PDS<span class="_ _1"></span> <span class="ls16 ws7">[35]</span><span class="ws21">. </span><span class="ls16"></span></span></div>

<div class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="4" id="pf4"><div class="pc pc4 w0 h0"><img alt="" class="bi x0 y15b w6 h19" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAASAAAAABCAIAAADxZuTwAAAACXBIWXMAABYlAAAWJQFJUiTwAAAAEUlEQVQoz2NgGAWjYBTQDAAAA2EAAUkZlNQAAAAASUVORK5CYII="/><div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">documents <span class="ws71">has been first described</span> and <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls15 ws4">successfully<span class="_ _0"></span></span><span class="ls28"> </span><span class="ws71">applied to PD</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">in [4<span class="ls1f ws2a">, </span><span class="ws7">15]<span class="ls3 ws21">. <span class="ls1c ws33">In </span></span><span class="ws2a">this context</span></span>, <span class="ls1b ws13">we </span><span class="ws7">prop<span class="ls15 ws4">ose</span></span>d <span class="ls2 ws3b">this definition</span>:</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h7 y15c ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">Citation<span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ws45">based Plagiarism Detection (CbPD) subsumes methods</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h7 y15d ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 wsce">that use citatio<span class="_ _1"></span>ns and referen<span class="_ _1"></span>ces for determi<span class="_ _1"></span>ning similaritie<span class="_ _1"></span>s</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h7 ye4 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">between documents in order to identify plagiarism.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y15e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws18">Citations and citation patterns offer unique features<span class="ls12 wsf"> <span class="ls2 wsab">that f<span class="ls1b ws13">acilita<span class="_ _0"></span>te</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y15f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws2f">a PD analysis<span class="ws21">. </span><span class="ls1b">They are<span class="_ _0"></span> </span><span class="ws21">a <span class="ls1b ws6">c<span class="_ _0"></span>omparati<span class="_ _0"></span>vely<span class="ls4d wsf"> </span></span><span class="ws33">easy to acquire,<span class="ls16 wsf"> language</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y160 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws50">independent marker, since more or less well-defined standards fo<span class="_ _1"></span>r</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y161 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9f">using them are established in the international scientific</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y162 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws32">community. This information can be exploited to detect forms of</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y163 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">plagiarism that cannot be detected with text-based approaches. <span class="_ _1"></span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h3 y164 ff3 fs1 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa">3.1<span class="ff1 ls9 wsf"> </span><span class="ls1d ws36">Factors for <span class="ls36 wsc7">Citatio<span class="_ _1"></span>n<span class="ls16 wsa">-b</span><span class="ws6c">ased Text S<span class="_ _1"></span>imilarity<span class="ls16 wsf"></span></span></span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y166 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws45">assessment for documents based on citations and references<span class="ls4f wsf"> <span class="ls37 ws4d">are</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y167 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">outlined <span class="ws2a">for de</span>riving <span class="ws2a">a suitable document model</span><span class="ls28"> </span><span class="ws2a">for CbPD</span>.</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h1a y168 ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.1.1<span class="ff2 ls50 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls70 wsc9">Shared<span class="ls16 wsf"> <span class="ls71 wsca">References</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h7 y169 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">Absolute Number<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y16a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws53">Having references in common is a well-<span class="ws48">known similarity criterion</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y16b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb7">for scientific texts called bibliographic coupling [23]<span class="ls3 ws21">. <span class="_ _6"></span><span class="ls1b ws13">The</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y16c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb9">absolute number<span class="ls51 wsf"> </span>of shared references represents the coupling</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y16d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">strength, which is used to measure the degree of r<span class="_ _1"></span>elatedness.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h7 y16e ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">Relative Number<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y16f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws57">The fraction that shared references represent with regard to the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y170 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws87">total number of individual references is another similarity</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y171 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">indicat<span class="ws48">or. Two texts<span class="wsf">, <span class="ff8 ls52"></span> <span class="_ _0"></span>and <span class="ff8 ls53"></span>, <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls2 ws49">are more likel<span class="_ _1"></span>y to be similar i<span class="_ _1"></span>f they</span></span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h1a y20c ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.1.4<span class="ff2 ls50 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls72">C<span class="ls70 wsed">hallenge of</span><span class="ls16"> <span class="ls6f">Identifying Ci<span class="_ _1"></span>tation Patterns<span class="ls16"></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y20d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">Detecting<span class="ls59 wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws32">citation patterns is a non-trivial task due to <span class="wsf">the <span class="_ _5"></span>diverse</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y20e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">forms of plagi<span class="ls37 wscd">arism</span>. Copy<span class="_ _0"></span>&paste plagiarism results in different</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y20f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">citation<span class="ls7 wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws35">patterns than e.g. shake&paste<span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _b"></span>plagiarism</span>. Therefore<span class="wsf">,</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y210 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6f">different algorithms<span class="ls73 wsf"> </span>are required to address the specific <span class="wsf">forms.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y211 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">The following challenges need to be considered.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y212 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws17">Unknown pattern constituents <span class="wsf">– <span class="_ _b"></span></span><span class="ff4">Unlike e.g. in string pattern</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y213 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws56">matching the subsequences of citations to be extracted from a</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y214 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7b">suspicious text and searched for within an original are initially</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y215 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3c">unknown. Citations that are shared by the two documents are</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y216 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws75">easily ident<span class="_ _1"></span>ified. H<span class="_ _1"></span>owever, it is<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls16 wsf"> <span class="_ _7"></span>un<span class="ls2 ws10">likely <span class="_ _7"></span>that <span class="_ _7"></span><span class="ls1b wsee">a<span class="_ _0"></span>ll of </span></span><span class="ws74">those shared</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y217 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">citations<span class="ls74 wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws3c">represent plagiarized text passages. For instance, two</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y218 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9d">documents might share 8 citations, of which 3 are contained</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y219 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws79">within a plagiarized text section and 4 are distributed over the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y21a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3e">length of the text and used <span class="wsf">along <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ls2 ws5">with</span><span class="ls75"> </span></span>other non-shared citations</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y21b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsd0">without representing any form of plagiarism. The citation</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y21c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws56">sequences of the two documents might therefore look like the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y21d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">following: <span class="ff5"></span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y21f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">Plagiarism:<span class="ls16 wsf"> <span class="_ _9"></span><span class="ffb">x x 5 x x x 4 x 3 x 1 x 2 x x 7 x 8</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y220 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws4">Num<span class="ls16 ws79">bers 1-8 represent shared citations, the letter x non<span class="wsf">-shared</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y221 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws76">citations. The shared citations 1-<span class="ws56">3 are<span class="_ _0"></span> supposed to represent a</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y222 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsf">plagiarized<span class="_ _1"></span> passage.<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ffb ls16"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y223 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">Transpositions<span class="ff4 wsf"> <span class="_ _5"></span>-<span class="_ _1"></span> <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ws46">the order of c<span class="_ _1"></span>itations within text segments might</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y224 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws30">be transposed compared to the corresponding<span class="ls55 wsf"> </span>original section<span class="wsf">.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y225 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsf">Possible caus<span class="_ _1"></span>es can be<span class="ls76"> <span class="ls16 ws2a">different citation styles or sort orders of the</span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y22a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws24">The semantically identical content might be expressed in the</div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y22d ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">Scaling<span class="ff4 wsf"> <span class="_ _7"></span>- <span class="_ _e"></span><span class="ws74">occurrences of shared citations can be used more than</span></span></div>

<div class="t m0 xa h22 y236 ffb fs5 fc0 sc0 ls77 wse9">Assessme<span class="wsf4">nt Z was able to proof <finding<span class="wsf0">3> <span class="_ _b"></span></span></span><span class="ffc">[3]</span><span class="wsf0">,</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h22 y237 ffb fs5 fc0 sc0 ls77 wsf">which had already been indicated by study X <span class="ffc wse9">[1]</span><span class="ls16">.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y238 ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb9">Missing alignment<span class="ff4 wsf"> <span class="_ _b"></span>- <span class="_ _d"></span><span class="wsb9">potentially plagiarized sections and their</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y239 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws43">corresponding originals need not to<span class="ls79 wsf"> <span class="ls3 ws42">be aligned, b<span class="_ _1"></span>ut can reside i<span class="_ _1"></span>n</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y23a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws50">very different parts of the text. For instance, the first para<span class="_ _0"></span>graph in</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y23b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws50">the first section of an original do<span class="_ _1"></span>cument <span class="ff8 ls62"><span class="ff7 ls42 wsf"> </span></span><span class="ls2 wsf5">might be plag<span class="_ _1"></span>iarized in</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y23c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">document<span class="ff7 ls42 wsf"> <span class="ff8 ls53"></span></span><span class="ws27">, however <span class="ls1b wsf6">it may </span><span class="ws57">become the fifth paragraph in the</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y23d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws19">third section of <span class="ff8 ls53"></span><span class="ls3 ws4a">. Th</span>e division of corresponding text s<span class="_ _1"></span>egments</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y23e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf7">into paragraphs, sections or chapters might also differ</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y23f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7b">significantly. For instance, a plagiarized text segment might be</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y240 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws32">artificially expanded or reduced to result in a different pa<span class="_ _0"></span>ragraph</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y241 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">split<span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ws2a">up in order to conc<span class="ls1b ws3b">eal the plagi<span class="_ _0"></span>arism.</span><span class="wsf"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h3 y242 ff3 fs1 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa">3.2<span class="ff1 ls9 wsf"> </span><span class="ls36 wsc7">Citation</span>-b<span class="ls1d ws36">ased <span class="ls36 ws6c">S<span class="_ _1"></span>imilarity Fun<span class="_ _1"></span>ctions<span class="ls16 wsf"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y243 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws50">Given the limited empirical knowledge base that exists for CbPD<span class="wsf">,</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y244 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 wsf5">it is intended to <span class="_ _1"></span>evaluate a balan<span class="_ _1"></span>ced mixture of p<span class="_ _1"></span>ossible similar<span class="_ _1"></span>ity</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y245 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws35">functions. The goal is to include global and local similarity</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y246 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws4">ass<span class="ls16 ws35">essments as well as functions that focus on the order of</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y247 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws4e">citations opposed to <span class="wsf">functions <span class="_ _7"></span></span>that ignore citation order, <span class="wsf">but <span class="_ _e"></span><span class="ls1b ws13">can</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y248 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf8">handle transpositions and scaling. Besides designing new</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y249 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws45">similarity functions based on the factors outlined above, testing</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y24a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws4">well<span class="ls16 ws7">-prov<span class="ws68">en similarity measures for their applicability to CbPD is</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y24b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">a further objective.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y24c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa4">The fact that citation sequences of documents can be</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y24d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">characterized as strings has been taken a<span class="_ _0"></span>s a starting point for</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y24e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws31">identifying existing similarity functions. In this context, string</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y24f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">refers to any collection of uniquely identifiable elements that are</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y250 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">linked in a way <span class="ls15 ws4">such<span class="ls8 wsf"> <span class="ls3">that each, except for<span class="_ _1"></span> exactly o<span class="_ _1"></span>ne leftmost an<span class="_ _1"></span>d</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y251 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">exactly one rightmost element, has one unique predecessor and</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y252 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">one unique successor [42]<span class="ls3 wsf9">. This </span><span class="wsf">definition <span class="ls15 ws12">is <span class="_ _a"></span></span>broader <span class="ls1c ws3c">than<span class="_ _0"></span> the</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y253 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws85">most prominent connotation of the term referring to li<span class="_ _0"></span>teral</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y254 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6f">character sequences in the domain of computer science. String</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y255 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws68">processing is a classical and comprehensively researched domain.</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y256 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 wsfa">Thus, multiplic<span class="_ _1"></span>ities<span class="ls24 wsf"> <span class="ls15 wsfb">of possible similarity assessment<span class="_ _0"></span>s can be</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y257 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">derived from this area see e.g. [<span class="ls1c wsc">17</span><span class="wsf">].</span></div>

<div class="t m0 x2d h12 y263 ff3 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">Figure <span class="ls16 ws7">4<span class="ws2a">: Categorization of eva<span class="_ _1"></span>luated similarity assessments<span class="wsf"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y264 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">According to the objectives outlined above, similarity approaches</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y265 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb4">for each category distinguishable in regard to the scope of the</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y266 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1a">assessment (global vs. local) and consideration of citation order</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y267 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsdf">have been d<span class="_ _1"></span>efined. In<span class="_ _1"></span> <span class="ls16 ws28">Figure 4<span class="wsf">, <span class="_ _0"></span></span></span><span class="wsff">the chosen similarity ass<span class="_ _1"></span>essments</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y268 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">are outlined.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h1a y269 ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.2.1<span class="ff2 ls67 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls7a">B<span class="ls70 wsed">ibliographic<span class="_ _1a"></span> <span class="ls72">C</span><span class="wsc9">oupling<span class="ls16 wsf"> S<span class="ls6f wsc8">trength</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y26a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsdc">Bibliographic coupling is one of the first and best<span class="wsf">-know<span class="_ _1"></span>n</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y26b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">citation<span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ls3 ws100">based <span class="_ _1a"></span>similarity assessm<span class="_ _1"></span>ents for acad<span class="_ _1"></span>emic texts<span class="_ _1a"></span>.</span></span></div>
</div>

<div class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="6" id="pf6"><div class="pc pc6 w0 h0"><img alt="" class="bi x3d y26c wd h28" src="data:image/png;base64,"/><div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">Similarity is quantified in terms of the absolute number of shared</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa0">references. Order or positions of citations within the text are</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye2 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">ignored<span class="ls3 ws10a">. It can be </span><span class="wsf">int<span class="_ _1"></span>erpreted <span class="_ _9"></span><span class="ls15 ws12">as <span class="_ _9"></span></span><span class="ws44">a raw measure of global</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye3 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws92">document similarity.<span class="ls7f wsf"> <span class="ls1b ws13">Solely<span class="_ _0"></span> </span><span class="ls16">considering <span class="_ _d"></span><span class="ws30">bibliographic coupling</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y26d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws74">strength is not a sufficient indicator for potential plagiarism and</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y26e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">does not allow pinpointing potentially plagiarized tex<span class="_ _1"></span>t segments. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h1a y26f ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.2.2<span class="ff2 ls50 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls70 wsed">Longest <span class="ls72">C</span>ommon <span class="ls72">C<span class="ls6f ws10b">itation <span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls80">S<span class="ls71 ws10c">equence <span class="ls16 wsf"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y270 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">The <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls16 ws50">Longest Common Subsequence (LCS) of <span class="ls1b ws2c">elements in </span></span><span class="wse0">a s<span class="ls16 wsf">tring</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y271 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws10d">is a traditional <span class="_ _1"></span>similarity measu<span class="_ _1"></span>re<span class="ls3 ws78">. The LCS <span class="ws10e">appro<span class="_ _1"></span>ach has been<span class="_ _1"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y272 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3a">adapted to citations and comprises the maximal number of</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y273 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws20">citations that can be taken from <span class="ls3 ws10f">a citation sequence <span class="ls2 ws10">without</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y274 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7c">changing their order, but allowing for skips over non<span class="wsf">-matchi<span class="_ _0"></span>ng</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y275 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">citations. For instance the sequence (3,4,5) is a subsequence of</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y276 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws5f">(2,3,1,4,6<span class="_ _1"></span>,8,5,9)<span class="ls16 wsf"> [8<span class="ls3">, p<span class="_ _1"></span>. 4<span class="ls16">].</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y277 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">Intuitively, considering the LCS of <span class="_ _0"></span>two citation sequences yields</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y278 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">hig<span class="ws6f">h similarity scores if longer parts of the corresponding text</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y279 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws110">have been <span class="ls16 wsf">ado<span class="_ _1"></span>pted <span class="_ _4"></span><span class="ls2 ws111">without altering<span class="_ _1"></span> the contained citation<span class="_ _1"></span>s.</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y27a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws65">Examining the Longest Common Citation Sequence has been</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y27b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws35">chosen because the measure features a clear focus on order</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y27c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1a">relation, opposed t<span class="ls2 ws112">o bibliogr<span class="_ _1"></span>aphic coupling<span class="_ _1"></span>. At the sam<span class="_ _1"></span>e time it</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y27d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws32">offers flexibility for coping with slight transpositions or arbitrary</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y27e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">sized gaps of non-<span class="ws21">matching citations. <span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y27f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws86">It is capable<span class="ls81 wsf"> </span><span class="ws43">of indicating<span class="ls81 wsf"> </span></span>potential<span class="_ _0"></span> cases of plagiarism in which</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y280 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">parts of the text have been <span class="wsf">copied <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls2 ws10">with <span class="_ _5"></span></span><span class="ws68">no changes, </span></span>or only slight</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y281 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">alterations <span class="ws92">in the order of citations. This can be the case for</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y282 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws74">copy&paste plagiarism that might have been concealed by basi<span class="_ _1"></span>c</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y283 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws113">rewording e.g. through synonym replacements. If significant</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y284 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws44">reordering within plagiarized text segments has taken place<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y285 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws56">(shake&paste plagiarism) or a different citation style has been</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y286 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws53">applied that permutes the sequence of citations, the <span class="_ _1"></span>LCS approach</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y287 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws12">is <span class="ls16 ws2a">bound to fail.<span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h1a y288 ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.2.3<span class="ff2 ls50 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls6f">Greedy Citation Tiling<span class="ls16"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y289 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsbe">Greedy Citation Tiling (GCT) is an adaption of a text string</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y28a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws48">similarity function proposed by W<span class="fs7 ls4a wsac v0">ISE <span class="_ _0"></span></span><span class="wsf v0">[51]. <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ws48">The original procedure</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y28b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws57">called Greedy String Tiling (GST) has explicitly been designed</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y28c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsaa">for usage in PD. It has been widely adopted and successfully</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y28d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">applied, <span class="ws2a">foremost in PDS for sof<span class="ws21">tware source code [1</span><span class="ls1f">, </span><span class="ws7">37]<span class="ls3 ws21">.</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y28e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws111">Greedy String/C<span class="_ _1"></span>itation Tiling aim<span class="_ _1"></span>s to identify all m<span class="_ _1"></span>atching</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y28f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws114">substrings with individually longest possible size in two</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y290 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws32">sequences. Individual longest matches refer to substrings that are</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y291 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1a">shared by<span class="ls82 wsf"> </span>both sequences and cannot be extended to the left or</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y292 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws45">right without encountering an element that is not shared by the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y293 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsbe">two sequences. Corresponding individually longest matches in</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y294 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws50">both sequences are permanently linked with each other and stored</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y295 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsf">as a so cal<span class="_ _1"></span>led tile. <span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls16"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h29 y296 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws77">A tile repr<span class="_ _1"></span>esents a tup<span class="_ _1a"></span>le<span class="ff7 ls83 wsf"> <span class="ff8 ls84"></span><span class="ls16 ws101">= (<span class="ff8 wscc"><span class="_ _1a"></span><span class="fs9 ls85 v2">1<span class="ff7 fs3 ls86 v3">,<span class="ff8 ls16"></span></span>2<span class="ff4 fs3 ls2 ws5 v3">,l)<span class="ls5f wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws6f">consisting of the starting</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h2a y297 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">position of a longest match in the first sequence<span class="_ _1"></span> (<span class="ff8 wscc"><span class="_ _1a"></span><span class="fs9 ls87 v2">1<span class="ff7 fs3 ls16 ws60 v3">)<span class="ff4 ws25">, the starting</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y298 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3e">position in the second sequence (<span class="ff8 wscc"><span class="_ _1a"></span><span class="fs9 ls87 v2">2<span class="ff4 fs3 ls16 ws84 v3">) a<span class="_ _0"></span>nd the length <span class="ls1c ws88">of t<span class="_ _0"></span>he mat<span class="_ _0"></span>ch</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y299 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws28">(l). The tiling approach i<span class="_ _0"></span>s illustrated in <span class="wsf">Figure <span class="_ _5"></span>5</span>. Arabic numbers</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y29a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsdf">represent equ<span class="_ _1"></span>al elements in<span class="_ _1"></span> the sequences<span class="_ _1"></span> to be analyzed<span class="_ _1"></span>, letter x</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y29b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7c">extraneous elements. Individually longest matches are indicated</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y29c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws18">by boxes around elements. Roman numbers above <span class="wsf">and <span class="_ _5"></span></span>below the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y29d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws28">boxes identify the tiles to which the matches have bee<span class="_ _0"></span>n assigned.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y29e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws74">As shown in the figure, the tiling approach is able to cope with</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y29f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3f">arbitrary transpositions in the order of individ<span class="_ _1"></span>ual substrings. A</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y2a0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls1b ws33">minimum siz<span class="_ _0"></span>e of m<span class="ls16 ws2a">atching substrings can be freely chosen.<span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="c x4a y2a1 we h2b"><div class="t m7 x4b h2c y2a2 ff9 fs10 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws102">x<span class="_ _26"></span>x<span class="_ _26"></span>x<span class="_ _26"></span>6<span class="_ _27"></span>x<span class="_ _26"></span>5<span class="_ _27"></span>4<span class="_ _27"></span>x<span class="_ _26"></span>x<span class="_ _26"></span>3<span class="_ _27"></span>2<span class="_ _27"></span>1</div>
<div class="t m7 x4b h2c y2a3 ff9 fs10 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws102">6<span class="_ _28"></span>x<span class="_ _26"></span>x<span class="_ _26"></span>x</div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2ad ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws115">The principle of the tilin<span class="_ _1"></span>g algorithm<span class="_ _1"></span> is illustrated in <span class="ls16 wsf">Figure 6</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2ae ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws45">assuming a minimum match length of 2. The procedure strictly</div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2b0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">used for keeping track of longest tiles and prevent elements from</div>

<div class="t m0 x34 h12 y2f7 ff3 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">Figure <span class="ls16 ws7">6<span class="ws2a">: Example flow of the<span class="_ _1"></span> Greedy Citation Tiling</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x60 h12 y2f8 ff3 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">algorithm.</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2f9 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2e">The algorithm performs full iterations of both sequences, mea<span class="_ _0"></span>ning</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2fa ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws26">that sequence 2<span class="_ _1a"></span> is iterated for every elem<span class="_ _1"></span>ent of sequ<span class="_ _1"></span>ence 1, as</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2fb ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9d">long as matches longer than or equal to the specified global</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2fc ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws44">minimum length are found in the respective iteration. This</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2fd ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws3b">indicates that th<span class="_ _1a"></span>e worst case <span class="ls16 ws21">complexity of the algorithm is<span class="ff7 ls42 wsf"> <span class="ff8 ls88"></span><span class="ls16 ws60">(<span class="ff8 ls2d"><span class="fs9 ls3e v1">3</span></span><span class="ls89">)</span></span></span><span class="ls3">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2fe ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws43">In each iteration only maximal matches are considered for being</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y2ff ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 wsf6">transformed into<span class="_ _1"></span> tiles. All individ<span class="_ _1"></span>ual longest match<span class="_ _1"></span>es identified</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y300 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws74">during the same iteration need to be equal to or longer than the</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y301 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls1b ws77">maximal<span class="_ _0"></span> matc<span class="ls16 ws3f">h fou<span class="ls2 ws116">nd in the same iteration<span class="_ _1"></span>. <span class="ls16 ws3f">If sequence 2 has</span></span></span></div>

</div>

</div>
