</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws17">been traversed for one element of sequence 1, all identified</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsf">maximal m<span class="_ _1"></span>atches are<span class="_ _1"></span> marked in<span class="_ _1"></span> the auxili<span class="_ _1"></span>ary arrays<span class="_ _1"></span>. <span class="ls16"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y15c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">For the next iteration the current maximal match length is again</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y15d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">set to equal the global minimum m<span class="ls2 ws115">atch leng<span class="_ _1"></span>th. This w<span class="_ _1"></span>ay, the</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye4 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">“next-<span class="ws32">shorter” matches to those marked during the prior iteration</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye5 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">are <span class="_ _7"></span><span class="ls2 ws10">identified. <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ls3 ws4b">One can see </span></span><span class="ws86">that this repetition continues until n<span class="_ _1"></span>o</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye6 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">more <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ws3e">matches longer tha<span class="_ _0"></span>n the global minimum match length can</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 ye7 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">be found, which results in the termination of the algorit<span class="_ _0"></span>hm. If the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y30e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws68">minimum match length is set to 1 the G<span class="_ _1"></span>ST algorithm is proven to</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y30f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3c">produce the optimal coverage of matching elements with tiles</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y310 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">[51]<span class="ls3 ws21">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y311 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws78">The G<span class="ls16 ws45">ST algorithm has been primarily designed for identi<span class="ls1c ws33">fying</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y312 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">shake&paste plagiarism. It is able to identify individually longest</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y313 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1c">substrings despite potential rearrangements<span class="ls2 ws11a">. Greedy Citation</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y314 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws73">Tiling might serve the same purpose, but opposed to the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y315 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">text-<span class="wsdc">based approach also <span class="ls2 ws5">identifies<span class="ls8a wsf"> <span class="ls1c wsc">para</span></span></span>phrased shake&paste</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y316 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">plagi<span class="ls3 ws21">arism. </span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y317 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws24">The GCT approach focuses on exact equality with regard to</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y318 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws43">citation order. Finding such patterns provides a strong indication</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y319 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws11b">for text similarit<span class="_ _1"></span>y. GCT is able to<span class="_ _1"></span> deal with transp<span class="_ _1"></span>ositions in the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y31a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws29">citation sequence that result from rearranging text seg<span class="ls3 ws21">ments,</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y31b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1f">which is typical for shake&paste plagiarism. However, the</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y31c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws11c">approach is not capable of detec<span class="_ _0"></span>ting citation scaling or</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y31d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7c">transpositions resulting e.g. from the usage of different citation</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y31e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1f">styles. For covering such cases, another class of detection</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y31f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">algorit<span class="ws48">hms has been designed, which is explained in the following<span class="_ _0"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y320 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws54">section. <span class="ls16 wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h1a y321 ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.2.4<span class="ff2 ls50 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls6f">Citation Chunking<span class="ls16"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y322 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7c">A set of heuristic procedures <span class="ls2 wsf6">that aim<span class="ls8b wsf"> </span>to identif<span class="_ _1"></span>y local citation</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y323 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws18">patterns regardless of potential transpositions and/or scaling <span class="ls1c wsc">hav<span class="_ _0"></span>e</span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y324 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">been developed for this study. The approach has been termed</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y325 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws4e">Citation Chunking because it is inspired by the feature selection</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y326 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws22">strategies of text-based fingerprinting algorithms. A citation</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y327 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws20">chunk is a variably sized substring of a document’s cita<span class="_ _0"></span>tion</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y328 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">sequence.</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y329 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">The main idea of citation chunking is to consider shared citations</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y32a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">as textual anchors at which local citation patterns can potentially</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y32b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">exist. Starting from an anchor, citation chunks are constructed by</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y32c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws48">dynamically increasing the considered substring of citations based</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y32d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws86">on the characteristics of the chunk under construction a<span class="_ _0"></span>s well as</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y32e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws21">the succeeding citations. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h7 y32f ff5 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">Chunking Strategies<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y330 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3f">Strategies for forming chunks have been derived by imagining</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y331 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws65">potential behaviors of a plagiarist and <span class="wsf">modeling <span class="ls1b ws13">t<span class="_ _0"></span>he <span class="_ _d"></span></span>resulting</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y332 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">citation patterns. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y333 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">Determining th<span class="ws7c">e starting and ending point for a chunk is not a</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y334 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 wse7">trivial task. <span class="ls3 ws55">There p<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls16 wsf">robably <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ws25">does not exist a<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls61 wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws25">best solution that fits</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y335 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws4e">all plagiarism scenarios. Larger chunks are believed to be better</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y336 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws8b">suitable for detecting overall similarities and compensate for</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y337 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">transpos<span class="ws68">itions and scaling. Smaller chunks, on the other hand, are</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y338 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3e">more suitable for pinpointing specific areas of highest similarity.</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y339 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws44">In order to experiment with both tendencies<span class="wsf">, <span class="_ _12"></span></span>the following</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y33a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">procedures for constructing citation chunks have been defined.<span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _1"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y33b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">1.<span class="ff2 ls8c wsf"> </span><span class="ls1b ws33">Only c</span>onsec<span class="_ _0"></span>utiv<span class="ws2a">e shared citations form a chunk:<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x66 h38 y33c ffb fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">Doc A: x,1,2,3,x,4,5,3,x,x</div>
<div class="t m0 x66 h38 y33d ffb fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">Doc B: x,x,3,2,1,x,5,3,4,x</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y33e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws67">This is the most restrictive chunking strategy. <span class="wsae">Its intention is <span class="ls1c ws33">t<span class="_ _0"></span>o</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y33f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9f">highlight confined text segments <span class="ls1c wsf8">that hav<span class="_ _0"></span>e<span class="ls8d wsf"> </span>a ver<span class="_ _0"></span>y hig<span class="_ _0"></span>h</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y340 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">citation<span class="ls16 ws7">-</span><span class="ws11d">based sim<span class="_ _1"></span>ilarity. <span class="ls37 wscd">It<span class="lse wsf"> <span class="ls15 ws12">is <span class="_ _0"></span><span class="ls16 ws53">ideal for detecting</span></span><span class="lsf"> <span class="ls16 ws53">pote<span class="_ _0"></span>ntial cases in</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y341 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws35">which copy&paste plagiarism might have been concealed by</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y342 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">rewording or translation. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y343 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">2.<span class="ff2 ls8c wsf"> </span><span class="ws3f">Chunks are formed dependent on the preceding citation. A</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x48 h6 y344 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws22">citation is included in a chu<span class="_ _1"></span>nk if <span class="ff8 ws117"> ≤ <span class="ff7 ws60">1</span></span><span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _4"></span>or <span class="_ _4"></span><span class="ff7 ws118">1 > <span class="ff8 ws119"> ≤ <span class="_ _0"></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x48 h6 y345 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">non-<span class="ws23">shared citations separate it from the last preceding shared</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x48 h6 y346 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">citation<span class="ls16 wsf">, <span class="_ _3"></span><span class="ls1b ws13">with <span class="_ _a"></span><span class="ff8 ls8e"></span></span><span class="ls8f"> </span><span class="ws79">being the number of citations in the chunk</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x48 h6 y347 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">currently <span class="ws21">under construction:</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x67 h38 y348 ffb fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">Doc A: x,1,2,3,x,x,4,5,x,x,x,x,x,x,6,7</div>
<div class="t m0 x67 h38 y349 ffb fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">Doc B: 3,2,x,1,x,x,4,x,x,x,x,x,5,6,7,x</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y34a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">Ch<span class="ws50">unking strategy 2<span class="lsd wsf"> <span class="ls1b ws13">aims <span class="_ _0"></span></span></span>to uncover<span class="ls90 wsf"> </span><span class="ws53">potential cases in <span class="_ _0"></span>which text</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y34b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws24">segments or logical structures have been taken over from or</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y34c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws24">influenced by another text. It allows for sporadic non<span class="wsf">-shared</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y34d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws10">citations <span class="_ _7"></span>that <span class="_ _e"></span><span class="ls1b ws13">may<span class="_ _0"></span> <span class="_ _e"></span><span class="ls3 ws7e">have been in<span class="_ _1"></span>serted <span class="ls16 ws67">to make<span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _7"></span>the <span class="_ _e"></span></span>resulti<span class="_ _0"></span>ng text</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y34e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">more <span class="_ _3"></span><span class="ws7c">“genuine”. It <span class="ls1b ws6">can</span></span><span class="ls2f"> <span class="ls1b ws6">als<span class="_ _0"></span>o</span> <span class="ls3 ws8e">detect poten<span class="_ _1a"></span>tial cases of concealed<span class="_ _1a"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y34f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws24">shake&paste plagiarism by allowing an increasing number of</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y350 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">non-<span class="ws86">shared citations within a chunk<span class="wsf">, <span class="_ _5"></span></span>given that a certain number</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y351 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">of shared citations have already been included. This process <span class="ls1b ws6">aims</span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y352 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws31">to reflect the behavior that text segments (including citati<span class="_ _0"></span>ons)</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y353 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">from different sources are interwoven.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y354 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">3.<span class="ff2 ls8c wsf"> </span><span class="ws87">Citations exhibiting a <span class="ls2 ws5">textual<span class="ls91 wsf"> </span></span>distance below a<span class="ls91 wsf"> <span class="ls3 ws21">certain</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x48 h6 y355 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">threshold form a chunk<span class="wsf">.</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y356 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">Chunking strategy 3 aims to define<span class="ls92 wsf"> </span>a textual range inside which</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y357 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">possible plagia<span class="ls1b ws11e">rism is dee<span class="_ _0"></span>med likely<span class="_ _0"></span>. </span>Studies have shown that</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y358 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws19">plagiarism more <span class="wsf">frequently <span class="_ _e"></span></span>affects confined text segments, such</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y359 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws67">as one or two paragraphs,<span class="ls5c wsf"> <span class="ls1c wsc">rat<span class="_ _0"></span>her</span><span class="ls30"> </span></span>than extended text <span class="ls3 ws5f">passages</span><span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _7"></span>or</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y35a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsbe">the document as a whole. Building upon <span class="ls2 ws5">this</span><span class="wsf"> knowledge, <span class="_ _d"></span><span class="ls1c ws33">the<span class="_ _0"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y35b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9d">respective chunking strategy only considers citations within a</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y35c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">specified range for forming chunks. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y35d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws11b">Since the split u<span class="_ _1"></span>p of a plagiarized tex<span class="_ _1"></span>t into textual un<span class="_ _1"></span>its, such as</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y35e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws29">sentences or paragraphs, might be altered artificially, <span class="ls1b ws13">textual</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y35f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9d">proximity might be<span class="ls93 wsf"> <span class="ls3 ws5f">analyzed</span> </span>in terms of <span class="ls2 ws5">multi</span>ple units. One</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y360 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">possibility tested in the study has been to count the characters,</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y361 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2e">words, sentences and paragraphs that separate individual citations.</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y362 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">The respective counts have been compared to average numbers</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y363 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws86">expected for a certain textual range. For insta<span class="ls3 ws4b">nce, one p<span class="_ _1"></span>aragraph</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y364 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">might <span class="_ _6"></span><span class="ws11f">on ave<span class="_ _0"></span>rage comprise 120 words consisting of 720</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y365 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws74">characters. If one shared citation is separated from<span class="_ _1"></span> another by 2</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y366 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2e">paragraphs, but less than 120 words<span class="wsf">, <span class="ls2 ws10">it <span class="ws120">will be </span></span></span>included in a chunk</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y367 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws4e">to be formed. In this manner, even<span class="ls94 wsf"> <span class="ls1b ws75">artifici<span class="_ _0"></span>ally c<span class="ls3 ws121">reated paragraph</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y368 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">split<span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ls3 wsf">ups can b<span class="_ _1a"></span>e dealt with. <span class="ls16 ws21"><span class="wsf"></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y369 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3e">Finding a suitable maximal distance for proximity of citations in</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y36a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">the text is highly dependent on the individual corpus analyzed. If</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y36b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsdc">e.g. the average length of documents is rather short,<span class="wsf"> <span class="_ _6"></span>and</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y36c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6d">individual documents contain smaller number of sections and</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y36d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">paragraphs<span class="ws71">, it is believed to be harder for a plagiarist to artificially</span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y36e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws122">alter the textua<span class="_ _1"></span>l <span class="ls16 ws7">structure<span class="ws20">. Consequently, a comparably lower</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y36f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws23">maximal distance should be chosen in this scenario. In contrast, it</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y370 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 wse5">is beli<span class="ls3 ws4a">eved to<span class="_ _1"></span> be easier to<span class="_ _1"></span> change e.g<span class="_ _1"></span>. the para<span class="_ _1"></span>graph split<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls16 ws7">-<span class="ws1a">up in</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y371 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws21">longer academic texts.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y372 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws71">The complete process of forming chunks according to the outlined</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y373 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws86">chunking strategies is graphically summarized as a flow chart in<span class="wsf"></span></div>

<div class="t m0 xa h6 y375 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">optional merging step is tested (<span class="wsf">dashed box <span class="ls2 ws5">in</span><span class="ls28"> </span></span>fi<span class="_ _1"></span>gure 7<span class="ls37 ws4d">). </span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y376 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws86">It is intended to combine supposedly suspicious cita<span class="_ _0"></span>tion patterns</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y377 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws50">in order to outline longer sections of similar text e.g. as part of an</div>

<div class="t m0 x4d h12 y38a ff3 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">Figure <span class="ls16">7: Forming of citation chunks<span class="wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h1a y38b ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.2.5<span class="ff2 ls50 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls70 ws129">Chunk Compar<span class="_ _1"></span>ison<span class="ls16 wsf"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y38c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws65">Once chunks have been formed, they are considered in their</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y38d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws27">entirety for comparison. <span class="ls3 ws5f">That<span class="ls97 wsf"> <span class="ls2 ws5">is</span></span></span>,<span class="_ _1"></span> the order of citations within a</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y38e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">chunk is disregarded during comparisons in order to account for</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y38f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws24">potential transpositions and/or scaling. The number of shared</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y390 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">citations within the units to be compared represents the measure</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y391 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls1b ws33">of simila<span class="_ _0"></span>rity. <span class="ls16 wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y392 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws3f">In the following two main strategies for comparing documents</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y393 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws7">ba<span class="ws71">sed on citation chunks are described. The first is to form chunks</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y394 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws71">for both documents and compare each chunk of the fi<span class="_ _0"></span>rst<span class="wsf"> document</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y395 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws5">with<span class="ls28 wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws21">each chunk of the second<span class="ls1f ws2a">. <span class="ls1b ws33">The c<span class="_ _0"></span></span><span class="ls16">hunk pairs having the highest</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y396 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws1f">citation ove<span class="ls3 ws12a">rlap are<span class="_ _1"></span> permanentl<span class="_ _1a"></span>y<span class="_ _0"></span> related <span class="_ _1"></span>to each other<span class="_ _1a"></span> and</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y397 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">considered <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ls3 ws55">a match. </span><span class="ws25">If multiple <span class="_ _1"></span>chunks in the documents have an</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y398 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">equal overlap, all combinations with maximal ov<span class="_ _1"></span>erlap are stored.<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y399 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws84">In the second scenario<span class="wsf">, <span class="_ _5"></span></span>chunks are constructed for one document</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y39a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa9">only. Subsequently, each of the chunks is compared to the</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y39b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws25">unaltered citation sequence of the second document by “moving”</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y39c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws4e">it as a sliding window over the sequence and assigning it to the</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y39d ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws3b">position with th<span class="_ _1a"></span>e maximal citation overlap<span class="_ _1"></span>.<span class="ls16 wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h1a y39e ff4 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls6f wsc8">3.2.6<span class="ff2 ls67 wsf"> <span class="ff5 ls70 ws129">Strength and <span class="_ _1"></span>Weaknesses of<span class="_ _1"></span> the Algorith<span class="_ _1"></span>ms<span class="ls16 wsf"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y39f ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">In the following<span class="wsf">, </span>the suitability of the presented algorithms is</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3a0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws79">classified according to their <span class="ls2 ws5">ability<span class="ls98 wsf"> </span></span>to detect different forms of</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3a1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">plagiarism.</div>

<div class="t m0 xb0 h12 y3dc ff3 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">[53 plagiarism] <span class="ls28 wsf"><span class="ls1f ws4d">by applying Citat<span class="_ _0"></span>ion Chunking<span class="_ _0"></span></span><span class="ls16"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3dd ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls2 ws130">In initial ex<span class="ls16 wsf">periments, <span class="_ _a"></span><span class="ws56">the described detection procedures have</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3de ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws46">been applied to prominent real world plagiarism cases in doctoral</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3df ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsb9">dissertations of German politicians [15]<span class="ls15 ws131">. As </span>the table shows,</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e0 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws32">Citation Chunking yield<span class="ls3 ws5f">ed<span class="ls63 wsf"> <span class="ls2 wsda">best detection re<span class="ls15 ws12">sults <span class="_ _5"></span></span></span><span class="ls16">in <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ls15 ws132">most ca<span class="_ _0"></span>ses <span class="ls2 ws5">in</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e1 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">our tests. However, for text segments in which large portions of</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e2 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2d">the contained citations <span class="ls3 ws4c">were adopted<span class="_ _1"></span><span class="ls9f wsf"> <span class="ls16 ws86">unaltered, e.g. in not-<span class="ls1b ws13">fre<span class="_ _0"></span>ely</span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e3 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws31">translated plagiarisms, Greedy Citation Tiling provide<span class="wsf">d <span class="ls3 ws21">clearer</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e4 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2e">indications for potential plagiarism.<span class="wsf"> Figure 9 <span class="_ _0"></span></span>shows an example of</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e5 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">a citation pattern identified by Citation Chunking<span class="ls1f">. </span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h3 y3e6 ff3 fs1 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa">3.3<span class="ff1 ls9 wsf"> </span><span class="ls36 ws133">Prototype Citatio<span class="_ _1"></span>n<span class="ls16 wsa">-b<span class="ls49 wsa6">ased PDS</span><span class="wsf"></span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e7 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">For <span class="_ _5"></span><span class="ws18">evaluating the different analysis procedures</span><span class="ls12"> <span class="ls15 ws12">we <span class="_ _5"></span></span></span><span class="ws18">developed a<span class="ls4b ws134">n</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e8 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws83">Open Source<span class="lsa0 wsf"> <span class="ls15 ws135">software syste<span class="_ _0"></span>m</span> <span class="ls3 ws82">in Jav<span class="_ _1"></span>a <span class="ls16 wsf">coined <span class="_ _b"></span><span class="ff5 ls2 ws5">CitePla<span class="ls1c wsc">g.<span class="lsa1 wsf"> </span></span></span></span><span class="ws21">The</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3e9 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">developed prototype CbPDS consists of three main components. <span class="_ _1"></span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3ea ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws43">The first is a Relational Database System (RDBS) termed CbPD</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3eb ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws67">database storing data to be acquired from documents as well a<span class="_ _0"></span>s</div>
<div class="t m0 xa h6 y3ec ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws136">detection r<span class="_ _1"></span>esults. The s<span class="_ _1"></span>econd is the det<span class="_ _1a"></span>ection software calle<span class="_ _1"></span>d</div>
</div>

<div class="t m0 x4f h52 y3fd ff3 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">Figure <span class="ls16 ws7">10<span class="ls15 ws81">: CbPDS system a</span></span><span class="ws5f">rchitectur<span class="_ _1"></span>e<span class="ff9 fs1 ls16 wsf"></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h3 y3fe ff3 fs1 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa">4.<span class="ff1 ls9 wsf"> </span><span class="ls1a ws3">CONCLUSIO<span class="_ _0"></span>N</span><span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y3ff ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws4e">Previous studies have shown that CbPD is suitable for detecting<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y400 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws47">forms of plagiarism that <span class="ls3 ws5f">remain</span><span class="wsf"> undetectable </span>for the<span class="wsf"> currentl<span class="_ _1"></span>y</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y401 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws6e">used text-based approaches. This paper has presente<span class="_ _0"></span>d three</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y402 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsf">algorithms <span class="_ _6"></span><span class="wsd0">for identifying <span class="ls2 ws13f">citation patterns th<span class="ls3 ws140">at<span class="_ _1"></span> have be<span class="_ _1"></span>en</span></span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y403 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wsa2">observed in real-world plagiarism cases. The algorithms are</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y404 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws76">coined Greedy Citation Tiling, Citation Chunking and Longest</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y405 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws2a">Common Citation Sequence. <span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y406 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 ws21">These <span class="ls2 ws120">algorithms are able to detect cit<span class="_ _1"></span>ation transposition<span class="_ _1"></span>s, citation</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y407 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 wse3">scaling and <span class="ls2 ws10">their <span class="_ _b"></span></span><span class="ws7">c<span class="_ _0"></span>ombina<span class="ws83">tions in cases of local and global</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y408 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws9d">plagiarism. The algorithms have been evaluated using several</div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y409 ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws67">plagiarized documents such as the doctoral thesis of <span class="wsf">Guttenberg</span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y40a ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws48">and by applying them to the PubMed Central Open Access Subset<span class="wsf"></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y40b ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws141">(PMC OAS)<span class="ls16 ws4e">. In <span class="wsf">[15] <span class="_ _7"></span></span></span><span class="ws142">i<span class="_ _0"></span>t was shown<span class="_ _0"></span> that <span class="ls16 ws4e">the proposed algorit<span class="_ _0"></span>hms</span></span></div>
<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y40c ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls16 ws92">could identify 13 out of the 16 sections containing <span class="wsf">translated</span></div>

<div class="t m0 x0 h6 y40e ff4 fs3 fc0 sc0 ls3 wsf">were unable<span class="_ _1"></span> to dete<span class="_ _1"></span>ct any <span class="ls37 ws4d">of <span class="ls1b ws6">them.</span></span><span class="ls16"></span></div>
